popt4jlib.neural

Class FasterFFNN4TrainBGrad

  • java.lang.Object
    • popt4jlib.neural.FasterFFNN4TrainBGrad
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, VecFunctionIntf

    public class FasterFFNN4TrainBGrad
extends java.lang.Object
implements VecFunctionIntf
    implements the Back-Propagation algorithm for computing the gradient of a feed-forward neural network FFNN4TrainB object, on a given (x,y) training pair. On 3-layer networks (2 hidden layers), it is about 20-40x faster than the FastFFNN4TrainBGrad algorithm. On 4-layer networks, the difference increases even more, and becomes between 24-160x faster!

    Notes:

    • 2020-09-18: made it work with CategoricalXEntropyLoss as output node as well.
    • 2020-09-19: fixed a serious bug that was present when the popt4jlib.neural.costfunction.[MAE|MSSE] functions are used as objective cost functions (division by the total number of training instances)

    Title: popt4jlib

    Description: A Parallel Meta-Heuristic Optimization Library in Java

    Copyright: Copyright (c) 2011-2020

    Company:

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Ioannis T. Christou
    See Also:

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      FasterFFNN4TrainBGrad(FFNN4TrainB ffnn)
      public constructor assumes that the network has been fully initialized with appropriate call to its finalizeInitialization(n) method before invoking this constructor.
      FasterFFNN4TrainBGrad(FFNN4TrainB ffnn, int num_input_signals)
      public constructor initializes the network by calling the network's finalizeInitialization(n) method with argument the second argument passed to this constructor.
      FasterFFNN4TrainBGrad(FFNN4TrainB ffnn, int num_input_signals, int num_threads)
      same as 2-arg constructor, but also initializes a thread-pool to compute the gradients of the network when given a single training pair (x,y) in parallel.

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      VectorIntf eval(VectorIntf x, java.util.HashMap p)
      computes the gradient of the feed-forward neural network associated with this object at the specified weights given by x.
      double evalCoord(VectorIntf x, java.util.HashMap p, int coord)
      computes the partial derivative of the feed-forward neural network (with biases) on the weights given by x with respect to the coordinate coord.
      private double[] evalGradient4TermB(double[] w, double[] train_inst, double train_lbl, int num_instances)
      implements the Back-Propagation algorithm for computing the gradient of the neural network automatically.
      private double evalNetworkOutputOnTrainingData(double[] weights, double[] train_instance, double train_label)
      evaluates the output of the output node of the network when an input (train_instance, train_label) pair is given.

      • FasterFFNN4TrainBGrad

        public FasterFFNN4TrainBGrad(FFNN4TrainB ffnn,
                             int num_input_signals)
        public constructor initializes the network by calling the network's finalizeInitialization(n) method with argument the second argument passed to this constructor.
        Parameters:
        ffnn - FFNN4TrainB
        num_input_signals - int the number needed for the initialization of the network.

      • FasterFFNN4TrainBGrad

        public FasterFFNN4TrainBGrad(FFNN4TrainB ffnn,
                             int num_input_signals,
                             int num_threads)
        same as 2-arg constructor, but also initializes a thread-pool to compute the gradients of the network when given a single training pair (x,y) in parallel.
        Parameters:
        ffnn - FFNN4TrainB the network whose gradient wrt weights this object computes
        num_input_signals - int the number of dimensions of the training data
        num_threads - int the number of threads in the thread-pool

    • Method Detail

      • eval

        public VectorIntf eval(VectorIntf x,
                       java.util.HashMap p)
        computes the gradient of the feed-forward neural network associated with this object at the specified weights given by x. The computation of the partial derivatives is exact (does not rely on GradApproximator) due to the auto-differentiation capabilities of the FFNN4TrainB class.
        Specified by:
        eval in interface VecFunctionIntf
        Parameters:
        x - VectorIntf the weights variables of the FFNN
        p - HashMap the parameters that must contain the traindata and train labels
        Returns:
        VectorIntf the gradient of the network at the given weights
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the train data pairs cannot be found

      • evalCoord

        public double evalCoord(VectorIntf x,
                        java.util.HashMap p,
                        int coord)
        computes the partial derivative of the feed-forward neural network (with biases) on the weights given by x with respect to the coordinate coord.
        Specified by:
        evalCoord in interface VecFunctionIntf
        Parameters:
        x - VectorIntf the weights at which the evaluation of the partial derivative takes place
        p - HashMap must contain keys "ffnn.traindata" and "ffnn.trainlabels"
        coord - int must be in {0,...#weights-1}
        Returns:
        double

      • evalGradient4TermB

        private double[] evalGradient4TermB(double[] w,
                                    double[] train_inst,
                                    double train_lbl,
                                    int num_instances)
        implements the Back-Propagation algorithm for computing the gradient of the neural network automatically.
        Parameters:
        w - double[] the variables (weights) at which we want to evaluate the gradient
        train_inst - double[] the training instance
        train_lbl - double the training label
        num_instances - int the total number of training instances we're working with
        Returns:
        double[] the gradient of the neural network at w

      • evalNetworkOutputOnTrainingData

        private double evalNetworkOutputOnTrainingData(double[] weights,
                                               double[] train_instance,
                                               double train_label)
        evaluates the output of the output node of the network when an input (train_instance, train_label) pair is given.
        Parameters:
        weights - double[] all weights array (includes bias terms)
        train_instance - double[] the training instance
        train_label - double the training label
        Returns:
        double

      • resetAllCaches

        private void resetAllCaches()
        reset all thread-local caches of the network associated with this object.
